intro: Cyclocheilon, commonly known as the cyclocheilon fern, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds that often exhibit a unique spiral arrangement. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Cyclocheilon has a complex reproductive system involving spores and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in many areas.
